column4: Actavis  Adamas win FDA approval for Alzheimer's drug
column5: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved a drug to treat dementia in Alzheimer's patients that was developed by Actavis Plc and Adamas Pharmaceuticals Inc.

column4: Google weighed security  free speech in move to stream Sony film
column5: Google Inc said on Wednesday it weighed the security implications of screening the Sony Pictures film  "The Interview " a comedy whose depiction of the assassination of North Korea's leader was blamed for a massive cyberattack.

column4: FBI arrests Colorado man over online threats to kill police
column5: DENVER FBI agents arrested a Colorado man who posted online threats advocating the killing of police officers after investigators received a tip about one of the messages from Google  prosecutors said on Tuesday.

column4: U.S. retailers likely to just meet holiday sales forecasts: experts
column5: CHICAGO U.S. consumers have not turned out in force for the final shopping days before Christmas  suggesting that traditional retailers will just meet industry sales forecasts in a season marked by deep discounts and growing encroachment from online rivals led by Amazon.com Inc .

column4: American Airlines says 'strong' profit to allow bigger wage hikes
column5: American Airlines Group Inc said Tuesday that it plans to pay flight attendants an additional four percentage points on top of raises already averaging 10 percent  thanks to profits that have strengthened as oil prices have collapsed.

column4: American Airlines says "strong" profit to allow bigger wage hikes
column5: Dec 23 American Airlines Group Inc said Tuesday that it plans to pay flight attendants an additional four percentage points on top of raises already averaging 10 percent  thanks to profits that have strengthened as oil prices have collapsed.

column4: UPDATE 1-Aspen  Cipla win share of $860 mln S.Africa AIDS drug tender
column5: JOHANNESBURG  Dec 24 South Africa will spend 10 billion rand ($860 million) between 2015 and 2017 on life-prolonging HIV/AIDS treatment drugs  health authorities said on Wednesday  as studies show the prevalence of the virus is rising.

column4: Facebook must face lawsuit over scanning of users' messages: judge
column5: Facebook Inc must face a class action lawsuit accusing it of violating its users' privacy by scanning the content of messages they send to other users for advertising purposes  a U.S. judge has ruled.

column4: Disgraced anti-sex slavery crusader Mam unveils plans for new group
column5: NEW YORK (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Disgraced Cambodian anti-sex trafficking activist Somaly Mam   who was forced to resign from her own foundation seven months ago amid reports her dramatic life story was fabricated  has unveiled plans to launch a new organization in January.

column4: SMBC to buy Citi Japan retail business in October: sources
column5: TOKYO Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp (SMBC) will buy Citigroup Inc's  Japanese retail banking operations in October for about 40 billion yen ($330 million)  people with knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-SMBC to buy Citi Japan retail business in October - sources
column5: * New business to focus on selling Citi-developed fin products   (Adds details of plan  official comment)

column4: U.S. Postal Service eyes e-commerce to offset declining mail
column5: CHICAGO  Dec 24 Facing a slump in the mail it had been delivering since the days of America's Revolutionary War  in 2012 the U.S. Postal Service began aggressively targeting e-commerce and lapsed customers as the way to salvage its declining business.

column4: Deutsche Bank open to offers for London gold vault: sources
column5: LONDON Deutsche Bank is open to offers for its London-based gold vault following the closure of its physical precious metals business  three sources familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column5: LONDON  Dec 24 Deutsche Bank is open to offers for its London-based gold vault following the closure of its physical precious metals business  three sources familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: UPS  FedEx cap air express deliveries: WSJ
column5: United Parcel Service Inc  and FedEx Corp  started limiting air express deliveries after a last-minute increase in shipped packages caused some retailers to exceed agreed-upon limits  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people briefed on the situation.

column4: Ebola crisis could last through 2015 as marks year since outbreak-expert-TRFN
column5: LONDON  Dec 24 (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - The Ebola crisis in West Africa that claimed its first victim exactly a year ago is likely to last until the end of 2015  according to a scientist who helped to discover the virus.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: Dec 24 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2100 GMT on Wednesday:

column4: Kellogg and Abraaj up bids in battle for Egypt's Bisco Misr
column5: CAIRO Kellogg Co   the world's largest breakfast cereal maker  once again raised its bid for Egyptian snackmaker Bisco Misr  on Wednesday  topping a rival offer from the UAE's Abraaj in an intensifying $144 million takeover battle.

column4: UPDATE 2-Kellogg and Abraaj up bids in battle for Egypt's Bisco Misr
column5: CAIRO  Dec 24 Kellogg Co  the world's largest breakfast cereal maker  once again raised its bid for Egyptian snackmaker Bisco Misr on Wednesday  topping a rival offer from the UAE's Abraaj in an intensifying $144 million takeover battle.

column4: Kellogg raises offer in bidding war for Egypt's Bisco Misr
column5: CAIRO  Dec 24 Kellogg Co. has raised its bid for Egypt's Bisco Misr to 89.86 Egyptian pounds ($12.57) per share  topping a rival offer by the UAE's Abraaj  the head of Egypt's financial regulator said on Wednesday.

column4: UAE's Abraaj seeks to raise bid for Bisco Misr in last-ditch effort to beat Kellogg
column5: CAIRO  Dec 24 UAE's Abraaj Investment Management is seeking regulatory approval to raise its bid for Egypt's Bisco Misr to 88.09 Egyptian pounds a share  aiming to top a rival bid by Kellogg Co. as the deadline for the takeover of the snackmaker loomed.

column4: Oil spin-off stocks could face longer road to recovery
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 24 oAs falling oil prices have ripped through energy stocks this year  five U.S. corporate spin-offs in the sector have not escaped the share price carnage and face a tougher road to recovery than more-established companies.

column5: BRASILIA Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff appointed 13 new ministers on Tuesday  choosing allied politicians in a cabinet reshuffle while trying to avoid any names that could be linked to a widening corruption scandal at state-run oil company Petrobras.
